Hey guys, new to the forums. Just wondering if anybody has any recommendations for buttons that you’d put on a driver station to control the robot.

We are using these.
https://www.amazon.com/Momentary-Button-Switch-Assorted-Self-Resetting/dp/B08SKJ6V7Z/ref=sr_1_5?sr=8-5
It’s our first time using them, and they are not tested for running code yet, but they wire up easy.

We used arcade buttons last year and they worked really well in 2 competitions. Use GenericHID for the controller in code. Also, look on thingaverse for arcade boxes. One observation though, we had to unplug the controller after each match or when it’s just sitting around as Windows disconnected that port. As long as you unplug it, then it works very well.

For the past 15 years we have based ours on ease of use and ease of access we give our driver an “Xbox” like controller and our operator a “Flightstick”

Logitech G F310 and Logitech G Extreme 3D Pro

we maybe go though 1 every 3 or so years

Black/Silver","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24683,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"272 Programming/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/buttons/484049/4","custom_user_title":"272 Programming/Strategy Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496167,"name":"Pat Mattin","username":"pmattin5459","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pmattin5459/{size}/182786_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T00:05:51.805Z","cooked":"

I would not recommend the Logitech controllers. Saving a few bucks compared to a standard Xbox controller or 3rd party alternative of reasonable quality isn’t really worth it, especially with that replacement rate. Even the $15 Gamestop specials we had before we bought the current set of controllers lasted at least 5 years. The flight sticks are fine, quality is still poor, I just don’t have enough experience to suggest a reasonable alternative.

Up to the driver and operator on what they want their controls to be at the end of the day though. We considered a button board, operator wanted to continue to use a Xbox controller. Their decision, we design the controls around them.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T00:05:51.805Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":23.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484049,"topic_slug":"buttons","display_username":"Pat Mattin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24683,"username":"gadzygadz","name":"Jake Gads","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gadzygadz/{size}/200701_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cheesecake Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/buttons/484049/5","custom_user_title":"Cheesecake Enthusiast","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496270,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T02:21:48.673Z","cooked":"

For gamepads, we’re auditioning these 8BitDo wired ones. Hall effect joysticks should reduce the chance of stick drift, which almost sank us at SCRAP 2023 when we rolled off the charge station right at the buzzer. $30 is cheap insurance.

If we get to custom buttons, we’ll likely do a box wired to a Raspberry Pi Pico and throw enough code on there to emulate an Xbox controller. No need to get cute at the level we’re at.

I bought this for $13 off amazon last summer

Arcade USB Encoder to Joystick

And bought these Buttons for another $13.

I plugged it in to our driver station laptop and it recognized the button immediately. Super simple, only $26 and no programming. There is a limit to the number of buttons this supports. You might need to buy 2 of them depending on what you’re trying to do.

FYI - not used in a comp season. Also, with anything, make sure wires are secured somehow. Don’t want a bot hitting your driver station wall during a match and knocking a wire loose.
